alert.note: Alert for Hardin; Nelson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 4:54AM EST until February 20 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Rolling Fork River near Boston affecting Hardin and Nelson Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Rolling Fork River near Boston. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, Agricultural bottomland is covered. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 AM EST Friday the stage was 31.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 34.9 feet tomorrow morning and then gradually decline through the remainder of tomorrow. - Action stage is 33.0 feet. - Flood stage is 35.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding is possible and rivers are forecast to exceed bankfull. If you are in the advisory area remain alert to possible flooding, or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued Friday morning.
